website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a handsome Garmin watch that will help you make the most of numerous types of activities and workouts, the Fenix 5X does it all. However, other Garmins have similar tracking functions, slimmer designs, and lower prices.
pros: Offers numerous tracking functions for multiple activities, including running, hiking, working out on a treadmill, and more
GPS earns praise for being responsive and accurate
band is interchangeable and doesn't require tools to replace
cons: Watch is somewhat bulky and the pricey
Inaccuracies with heart rate function have been noted

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY GARMIN ON AMAZON!! GO DIRECTLY TO GARMIN USA PAGE
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY GARMIN ON AMAZON!! GO DIRECTLY TO GARMIN USA PAGE I bought this watch on May 2017 and now (March 2018) it stopped working. I contacted Garmin USA - because I bought it right here on this page - and I was informed by Garmin USA that they cannot do anything about it. My watch should be replaced but Garmin USA cannot do anything because MY WATCH IS REGISTERED IN SOUTHEAST ASIA!!!!! I am trying to contact Garmin Asia, but as I don't speak any Asian languages it is extremely difficult to solve this problem. I WAS CHEATED BY AMAZON!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Roberto Loução

customer_reviews.title: the watch is amazing, but the Fenix 5S I got is the ...
customer_reviews.text: Be aware of this seller, the watch is amazing, but the Fenix 5S I got is the APAC model, which is not meant for the US or the US IQ Store, therefore you can't download apps like strava, watch faces, etc. Pretty limiting in terms of apps and other features. Seller should mention this detail for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maximiliano J. Correa F.

customer_reviews.title: A lot of wear shown on watch from previous owner.
customer_reviews.text: Was excited for this refurbished unit and wound up getting a nasty one. I don’t think it truly was reburbished. It has someone’s sweat caked on the back around the heart rate monitor. There’s knicks around the front Bezzle as well as a nice gash in the front glass. Really disappointed with garmin. Had this been much cheaper I wouldn’t complain but this is a $400 watch. Probably returning. Please see photos for further details.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S.

customer_reviews.title: Seller Not Selling Watches for America
customer_reviews.text: I contacted Garmin and was told this seller is selling watches for New Zealand not America. It is the wrong time zone. The watch face was also not plumb or straight. It tilts slightly right as you can see in the photo. the circle on top at t5he 12 o'clock position is not plumb between the band. Luckily Garmin is replacing the watch. You purchase through Amazon on Good Faith that their sellers are legitimate, obviously not.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS BY FAR THE BEST WATCH I HAVE EVER OWNED
customer_reviews.text: OKAY, I AM A HUGE WATCH GUY. HAVE CITIZEN, BREITLING, ROLEX, APPLE WATCH. I WEAR THEM ALL UNTIL I GOT THIS. THIS IS BY FAR THE BEST WATCH I HAVE EVER OWNED. DURABLE, COMFORTABLE, AND EASY TO READ THE SCREEN IN BOTH DAYLIGHT, AND DARKNESS WHEN YOU USE THE BACKLIGHT. USED THIS HIKING IN YOSEMITE. WOW. TOLD ME EVERYTHING I NEEDED TO KNOW. YOU CAN MAKE YOUR OWN WATCH FACES, OR GET OTHERS FROM GARMIN. I CAN'T TELL YOU HOW MUCH OF A MISTAKE YOU WILL MAKE BY USING OTHER SMART WATCHES. THIS IS THE BEST ONE I HAVE EVER OWNED. USED IT AT THE GYM AND IT IS SUPER ACCURATE. I LOVE THIS, AND WEAR IT ALL THE TIME.
customer_reviews.author: MJB

customer_reviews.title: Sent a refurbished item while we've ordered a new one
customer_reviews.text: In the description, it says that the watch is NEW but when we opened the box - there was a smaller box with a 'refurbished' print all over it. There was just a watch with instructions and NO charging cable in it. Severely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Iuliana

customer_reviews.title: The heartbeat monitor works much better if you align it with your artery on your ...
customer_reviews.text: The major selling point to this is the 1:24k maps that come installed, but think of this as a GPS fitness device with smartwatch aspects rather than a smartwatch. The thing is incredibly well built, and even with 1 workout a day using GPS, you'll need to charge this maybe once every two weeks. This thing is huge and built to last, unlike many watches that feel kind of flimsy. The heartbeat monitor works much better if you align it with your artery on your wrist then on the outside of the wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Z.

customer_reviews.title: It looks great, but....
customer_reviews.text: I sent this watch back mostly because it’s too heavy and too busy. Secondary and also important was the pacing was scurrilous. I had it set for every second and gps/glonass and the pace recording range was unusable. I’m presuming there might be something wrong with the accelerometer because it was very inaccurate recording steps. I would also run with my trusty but aging 920xt to compare and it was as if the Fenix was on another runner.
customer_reviews.author: passedpast

customer_reviews.title: Returned - Too Old for Out of the Box Issues for Version 5X
customer_reviews.text: Longtime Garmin user. Liked the style. A big improvement over previous devices after getting competition from fitness vendors. Extremely annoying persistent (every 100 feet or so) ANT device notification with only beta software to fix. Patience for defective Garmin software lost years ago. Going elsewhere now.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: A costly gps watch, but worth it if...
customer_reviews.text: If you have the money to spare or just want a higher quality gps watch the Fenix 5s sapphire is an excellent choice. So far it has withstood multiple dings on everything from metal to wood, has been submerged in the ocean for extended periods and withstood extreme tempreratures. The sapphire glass is definitely worth getting for a battery powered watch at this point, the inclusion of actual maps on only the 5x is a bit of a disappointment but for my wrist I am most comfortable with the 5s size. The quick change bands are nice but a bit on the expensive side for a piece of rubber. Overall I am pleased with the watch and it functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan l

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness watch
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for few weeks and have been putting it through the paces pretty hard. From sweaty trail runs to hiking to indoor treadmill, this watch will become your best friend. The sleep tracking seems pretty accurate and overall this watch is easy to operate and intuitive. I've been getting about 8-11 days on a charge & that's pretty good in my opinion considering how much I use this. I'm very pleased! Will update in future if needed
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wonderful

customer_reviews.title: Altimeter Barometer malfunction
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a Black Friday item. Excellent watch but after a few days of inaccurate Altimeter/Barometer readings, I called Garmin Support. They had me run tests in developer mode and it was deemed Baro Sensor was “bad”. I am doing a return swap through Amazon because I still want the watch, just an operational one. Amazon allowed for replacement while I hold on to original broken one. Customer support hs been excellent, but very unhappy with having to wait 5-6 weeks for a functioning watch that costs $$$.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeShopper

customer_reviews.title: Fenix 5 continues to be the superior benchmark for serious athletic tracking.
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin Fenix 5 continues to be a reliable piece of tech for serious and amateur athletes. I use the device for marathon running, swimming and mountain biking. In all categories it appears to provide accurate data. My only complaint is that I will occasionally get some inaccurate sleep tracking info. Sometime it will start to log sleep when I’m watching a movie or staying still around the hours I would normally go to bed. The heart rate and VO2 Max data help me track and understand my efficiency and athletic age, encouraging me to push myself when I need it. Overall, I highly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Kappy

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, but HR inaccuracies are unacceptable at this price range
customer_reviews.text: It is a great gadget made with premium material. Having said that, current inaccuracies in HR readings are specially annoying when considering the cost of this watch. It is not that it's 10% or 20% above or below the "real" beats per second, the fact is that when I do indoor water-rowing, HIIT and strength-training the HR reading goes to 50-55 BPS, which I can only realistically achieve when sleeping! Moreover, as soon as I put a chest strap midway through the workout, the HR goes up to 150 BPS. I hope is a software issue and in that case will update this review immediately, but if this is a permanent hardware thing I will return this watch very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Barrios

customer_reviews.title: Multi purpose computer on your wrist
customer_reviews.text: I was using a bike computer for tracking cycling, my phone for tracking walks, and a Garmin handheld for tracking hikes. This watch does everything, and it is consistent and reliable. Plus, it is so convenient. I ride three different bikes, and this thing is always on me. There is no need to move it from one bike to the other. I still use a bike computer for veiwing my stats while riding (speed, cadence, heart rate), but I only upload the Fenix to Strava.
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device, exceeded my expectations, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic device, exceeds my expectations. Took a little getting used to figuring out the functions, and I am a Garmin aficionado for several years now. However, once I got the hang of what the buttons do, the functionality and ease-of-use mKe this an extremely rewarding and very effective tool. I really like this watch/fitness device and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: td

customer_reviews.title: This one is the best. Look no further.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, I ordered 4 watches, and selected this one out of them. I have been using Garmin since 2009. So ten years now, and just stopped last couple years because Fenix were way too expensive and the others had one thing or another lacking, while my older watches lost functionality. This one is at a reasonable price now, has a neat display, style and perfect size. Not too big nor tiny defying the whole purpose of a sports watch. Its elegant yet doesn't look feminine or decorative. It looks "classy rugged". I mean "rugged" doesn't have to look cheap you know. Go for it, without wasting time on others. Do get a screen protector though.
customer_reviews.author: Rachna Chopra

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade from a FR 230. The FR230 worked very well for me for 2 years with only requiring a replacement band. I bought the NOH model to save some cash. So far, I am impressed by the device. The bezel had some scratches on it, but it is a refurbished model. The battery is much better than the 230 and that is with the HR working. Only time will tell how this will work, but right now, I M very happy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grabowy

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My old original FENIX finally bit the dust and I was not sure whether to replace it with another FENIX or go down the Garmin product line to something else. I am glad I stuck to the FENIX although I avoided the extra expense of the sapphire or the 5X versions. This model has plenty of good functions and I like the easy to read face and the battery life. It took only a few minutes to set up and I have used it a lot in the past few weeks to record bike rides and other workouts. Also enjoying the bluetooth link to my phone. I hope this lasts as long as its predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: robin

customer_reviews.title: Still putting it through its paces
customer_reviews.text: Well the watch came ice-cold dead so it took about 5 hours to get it fully charged and able to function. I had to research how to reboot it in order to get it to turn on for the first time. Then it took a full 24 hrs for the watch to sync up with the app on my phone. But after the headache of getting it up and running, it's been running real smooth.....like an old big block Chevy lol
customer_reviews.author: Quincy T

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for swimming
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful watch with some amazing features. However, as a swimmer I am disappointed. The heart rate monitor turns off when the swimming feature is activated. Not only does it not give you an accurate read on your work out, it also does not count swims towards your workout intensity for the week. As a swimmer, I am not happy with this watch. I purchased a Tri-band to get a heart rate in the pool, but the watch was unable to sink. For hikes, runs, biking... this is a fantastic watch.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Amazing All Terrain Sport Watch Garmin Fenix 5x Sapphire
customer_reviews.text: Really an all-terrain watch ready to do all kinds of sports It comes with a deluxe metal bracelet, additional brought a rubber band, you can use it executive mode with the metal bracelet or ready for any sport with the rubber band, very easy to change, no tools needed I connected the clock to my laptop and it was easy to update the software and have all the apps and others available in minutes This watch is really everything I expected, I bought it to replace a Fenix 3 HR and it really was an excellent decision
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Love the watch even though it is not touchscreenbut not the band.
customer_reviews.text: I love my watch even though it's not touchscreen but the band is for kids, my wrist is average, and I have to take it off once in a while. Looking to get a better band and comfy. Update: I hate that 5 feet away from my phone it is connecting and disconnecting.
customer_reviews.author: Jcmak

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using This watch for running and HIIT training . Pros: + As a Hebrew user , the Watch has built in Hebrew support. + Battery life is great + Although the big size - it is very comfortable on the hand. + Buttons works very well . and their placement and feel are very well designed. + Sapphire display is a great when the type of activity is Crossfit/HIIT using kettlebells etc. Cons: - User interaction with the clock is done ONLY with buttons on the side - The charging cable is not that comfortable. ( i bought a their party "cradle" charger which i prefer)
customer_reviews.author: Amit

customer_reviews.title: Best fitness watch, hands down!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been through a few fitness watches over the years and this one knocks it out ot the park. I am extremely rough on a watch so durability was a must for me. Banged into all sorts of things already and not a scratch. The battery life is absolutely stunning. The photo was taken 2 weeks after I fully charged and put on my wrist for the first time....still 5% was remaining but went ahead and charged up since I'm about to leave for a trip. Fits well and is very comfortable compared to some that protrude into the wrist bone. Would buy again if I ever have the need.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Fast GPS linking to satellites
customer_reviews.text: Have used for 1 year. Main reason to purchase was distance gps. Previously owned a Suunto, but took too long for gps connection (15-20 minutes). Easy to use and navigate. Feels heavy and sturdy. I use the watch for hiking, bicycling, snowboarding. No rash or "marking" from heart rate sensor. Why not 5 star ? Distance not matching in "walk" mode vs. "hike" mode. I tested each on same trail. Walk mode was 3.88 miles. Hiking mode was 3.94 miles. Same day, exact same trail but why 0.06 miles / 317 feet difference ?
customer_reviews.author: m. fung

customer_reviews.title: Too big for average size women
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful watch but even at 42mm it is not sized for a woman's wrist. The watch face itself is the size of my wrist but then there is the additional width needed for the wrist band to attach and that makes it quite a bit wider than my wrist. And I am an average size female (technically a little over weight 27%bmi). Much bigger and bulkier than my previous Vivoactive. I should have just stayed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Completely dead 15 months after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Note the other reviewers that have warned about charging problems and it dying quickly.. Mine stopped taking a charge and is completely dead 15 months after purchase--right after the 1 year warranty. So you have a $500 watch that only lasts 15 months. The problem is the exposed charging port. Maybe that is fine if you don't sweat or are never in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Good Morning! Did not like. Not knowing English, when buying I did not realize that the product was restored. There was also no cable to carry the watch. Unfortunately I had many problems with this purchase, so I will not buy more from Amazon. Thanks for listening. Marcello Guedes
customer_reviews.author: Marcello da Costa Guedes

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Device
customer_reviews.text: The Fenix 5 was exactly everything I hoped I was purchasing. Easy to setup, accurate tracking of fitness data and activity. Cosmetically pleasing with ability to switch out watch bands for any occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Jonn Betzer

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets
customer_reviews.text: I love the 5X Garmin. I've had it now a long while and its performed flawlessly. Every possible feature you could want including wrist heart rate. Good looking, durable, automatic bluetooth connection with the app do downloads are a breeze. I'll wear this one out and buy the latest model someday but for now this is as good as it gets
customer_reviews.author: swassociates

customer_reviews.title: Waited for sale price...worth it at full price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am an Apple believer, but I didn't want everything the Apple Watch does. Also, wanted the best watch for the Montana outdoors. This is the watch for that. I love it! After not wearing a watch for years, this one was the perfect smart watch for me. Highly recommend, especially if you hike, bike, snowmobile... Great watch for western Montana!
customer_reviews.author: Carman VanSchaick

customer_reviews.title: The Fenix has always been a great fitness watch with all the bells and whistles but ...
customer_reviews.text: The Fenix has always been a great fitness watch with all the bells and whistles but it was quite large and didn't look right on most women. Now the 5S is perfectly for women of a medium to small builds. I'm so glad I waited for the perfect watch to come along. You will love it whether you are runner, swimmer, cyclist, paddler, etc. It covers it all.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice smart watch
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice smart watch, well built, looks good, and the strava integration is good. But! * The sleep monitor is worthless. It's just based on motion so it's no good at tracking when you wake up and night unless you move a bunch. * The heart rate monitor is poor at high heart rates. It seems good when I'm relaxed, but (say) cranking up a hill on my bike a chest monitor says 180bpm, but the watch seems to think I'm chilling at 110.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: The watch has been great. Aside from tough and rugged, it looks great. The ease of changing straps for different ocasions is awesome. The gps is great i have used it for hunting and long multi day hikes. The only thing thst is a little off is the heart rate monitor i runs a little high for my activities and low for resting unless you use chest strap monitering. For people with large wrist the saphire looks great for smaller men and women it may feel large/ bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Best sports watch!!
customer_reviews.text: The watch is amazing but if you have the fenix 3 and you don't mind the maps feature I'm not sure the upgrade is worth it! But in simple words is the best possible watch you can own to do any sport !!!
customer_reviews.author: jjponcem

customer_reviews.title: Contractor approved
customer_reviews.text: I am a contractor, so I appreciate the rugged construction of this watch. Using buttons only will save the face of the watch in the long run, and keep it clean. The band was plenty long for my big wrist. Usually, I need to purchase XL straps. The only modifications I did was add a dust plug for the charging port, and I put a screen protector on the face. They can both be found on Amazon. 13 days of battery life at least with some to spare. I use the watch for time, date and reading texts. I do not use the maps, or many of the other features.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Longanbach

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for those that want workout details
customer_reviews.text: It took me a couple weeks to learn how to use this watch, so give it some time if you're not familiar with the Garmin products. That said, I do love it. I've learned a lot about my running style, especially my gait, which I have enjoyed and has impacted my form (I'm a tall runner, and I take too long of a stride). I'm not a fan of the weight lifting workouts - the watch doesn't account for it very well, so I don't use it during those workouts.
customer_reviews.author: K. Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Over the years I have really grown to love Garmin. I have thrown away all my Android Wear and other smart watches and I'm sticking with this one. I had the Fenix 3 and at first I didn't think the upgrade was worth it. It is so worth it! The sleep tracking is better, the mapping is very useful (and fun), and the alerts are now actionable. The apps are all more sophisticated now. The battery life is legendary
customer_reviews.author: O. Khouri

customer_reviews.title: there's a lot to the watch
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning cool things about this watch. It's been very useful in helping me reach heart rate goals. Add the map, barometer, compass and all the exercises and this thing is definitely worth the money I am having issues with turning off GPS and loading up custom exercises built from my phone. There are some things that for security I want to have control over and I don't. Otherwise the watch is very useful
customer_reviews.author: Paul lees

customer_reviews.title: It was returned....
customer_reviews.text: I am sure the unit was very good but when I opened the box and saw the size, I knew I didn't want to wear anything that large. I opted for a Vivosmart 4 which met my needs. My return was processed quickly. My rating only had to do with the size and not the performance of the device.
customer_reviews.author: AZNorb

customer_reviews.title: this unit is very easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: Well I have shopped and waited for several years before purchasing a smart watch/devise. Garmin Fenix 5X Sapphire was the winner. I thought I would need to have some wizzard help me set it up,,,not at all. The set up was very easy and straightforward. tons of u-tube help and well it just was not a problem. The number one option I wanted was a GOLF app, got it and a very good one sorry golf buddy you lost out! Step counter, got it sleep monitor got it,,,and so much more! I love my new tool of life and suggest any one looking for a smart watch, look this way! Garmin hit a home run !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine GUY

customer_reviews.title: Hope it is the right watch
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve seen this watch before and it is a pretty awesome smart watch, but when I got mine in the mail, it was the wrong watch. A lesser version of the Fenix 5s series but I put a replacement in with customer service so hopefully the right one comes in soon. I will update this review if it is the right watch.
customer_reviews.author: JadeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Quality watch, pushes me to be active!
customer_reviews.text: - Nicely built - Came with a second rubber bracelet - Fitness tracking from workout, steps, heart rate, sleep are quite good and app is really nice. - Very customizable with watch faces and activity/apps. - Since it's a Garmin, location tracking and navigation is spot on. Wouldn't use it to navigate in a car though.
customer_reviews.author: neburQ

customer_reviews.title: Fancy Garmin , great watch
customer_reviews.text: Great Garmin watch and also looks beautiful. It takes a few time to learn how to use it , but then it’s great . It reads everything including how you sleep and your stress day. It’s a multi sport wach. A fancy Garmin that you can wear anytime. Love it ! It’s very similar to the forerunner 935 in the characteristics, but this is more elegant. The forerunner it’s more sport watch. This Fenix 5 you can get it with Safire glass and it’s a fancy watch to go everywhere with it
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this watch! The battery life is exactly what they claim and the data available for you to analyze on your personal fitness performance is fantastic. I use this watch for running and biking and I have been impressed with the distance accuracy, heart rate accuracy and all the data elements I get to review after a workout. Without question all of this comes at a price, but in my case I would say this was worth the investment I made in the watch.
customer_reviews.author: paul12345

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: I seriously never write reviews. But this thing is SO much better than my old Apple Watch I had to. Buy it ... You’ll be stoked. Started broadcasting HR to my Garmin 520 for MTB which is awesome also. As with garmin things it takes a bit to figure out, but once you do it’s insanly capable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garmin did this one right!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned it 5 months now and it’s simply amazing! Hiking, Snowboarding, surfing, cardio workouts, you name it I’ve tried it with this watch. I have a very physical, manual labor job which can tend to destroy my watches...so far the only wear is on the band. Which is amazing in itself. Battery life is excellent. Even when I’m tracking all day the watch will go for 13 hours before a recharge. Normal usage I’m getting a week between charges. Then when I do have to charge it, it does so in a very short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennapaige28

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Fenix 3. Nothing wrong with my Fenix 3 just wanted to upgrade. If you have a 3 you'll love the 5x. I'm very happy with the battery life, it stated 10 days in smart watch mode. I have tested the 20 day claim 4 times and all 4 times it far exceeded it. Avereged between 13-15 days in smart watch mode.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Great looking watch.. but heart rate during workout is completely wrong. Sleep monitor is not accurate. I was using Fitbit Versa and it was way more accurate than Garmin. I switched to Garmin and am totally disappointed. Hope Garmin sends and upgrade to improve heart rate readings and sleep monitor..
customer_reviews.author: osman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy Garmin from Amazon. Refurbished i
customer_reviews.text: After almost three years watch stops work and Garmin said the watch is refurbished Amazon is selling products like new, but they are refurbished!
customer_reviews.author: FFC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for Fénix 3 Sapphire
customer_reviews.text: Excellent watch , nice size , very resistant I’ve a tendency to hit my watches with table ledges and doors hahaha but so far ( 1 month ) it’s on perfect condition no dents at all . Very accurate hr tracking while running but not while doing other anaerobic exercises ( CrossFit , or regular gym )
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: I have had for 2-3 weeks and i really enjoy it. I am now paying attention to my ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this watch primarily to train for OCR (Spartan) races. I have had for 2-3 weeks and i really enjoy it. I am now paying attention to my pace/ cadence / training heart rate-I never did that before. It is probably more watch than i need- i keep learning a new. I believe it is taking my training to a new level. I have lost approx 5 lbs since having-- i think because i am paying attention and eating better. I have not needed the sapphire face yet. I thought i might- but no scratches via regular running / weight lifting / trail running / crossfit. I will not wear on an actual race.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Craven

customer_reviews.title: Do-it-all top of the line piece of gear.
customer_reviews.text: A stylish do it all watch. I intended it for hiking and sports but ended up wearing it all the time. Awesome battery life, up to date tech, and stylish. I have very slender wrists and don't like bulky watches - this is perfect. Sturdy as well, went for the sapphire. Have hit it on rock etc, probably the outer ring will eventually show wear, but the glass seems bullet proof. The screen does tend to get ever so slightly oily, but it's hardly noticable. If you're active and want a watch that does it all without being bulky and heavy - this is it. If you want a dedicated smart watch, there are probably better and cheaper one's.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: The best watch all around. This is a great watch for outdoor/exercise enthusiast it tracks exercises and calories perfectly. Battery lasts over a week on a single charge and that is with 1 hour of GPS tracking a day and that is great as well. Right now no watch can touch the Fenix 5. If you are looking for a great watch this is a great choice. And the ease of switching up the wrist bands is great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jesenko J.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Loving my watch! The corresponding apps let me pick fun and helpful watch faces and keep track of all my fitness stuff, coupled with a new gym membership I've been losing weight! We also bought the garmin scale. All in all great purchase
customer_reviews.author: SariseTG

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch
customer_reviews.text: So far I've mostly used the watch for pool swims and running. It has been great to be able to count on the watch being accurate. I previously had the samsung gear fit 2 pro that was nowhere close on accuracy so this has been a great upgrade. The watch works great so far. It will be nice to try it in open water when winter is over and it warms up here.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Lighter, significantly lighter!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from 3HR and felt might not be a big deal. It is significantly lighter, slightly better UI, the drop in battery life is a compromise worth making. After a week of decent use it still had 55% juice left. It has become my primary device on my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: SWTHA SREE C

customer_reviews.title: Love my Garmin Fenix 5s
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS WATCH. Everything I was looking for. Love being able to use navigation while doing a walk/run. Nothing super fancy, but once you create a “course” via “ garmin connect and then send to watch; start your workout, it’ll send basic tone or vibration warning with an arrow in direction you should turn. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: HeLovesMe

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Sports Watch
customer_reviews.text: Great sports watch, exceptional capability, easy to use, big but comfortable. User interface easy to learn and intuitive. Upgraded from the Garmin Vivo Active HR.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: The good Great looking and Durable design Outdoor-readable display Long battery ...
customer_reviews.text: The good Great looking and Durable design Outdoor-readable display Long battery life Customizable display The bad Expensive Low-resolution screen My final opinion: With more than 20 hours of battery life, the ability to track almost any activity and a durable design, the Garmin fenix 5 is the outdoor GPS watch to get.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson L Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Good, but still wanting.
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a GPS watch. Still a bit off the mark as a fitness device. HR tracking can lag actual rate if doing other than steady state work. Sleep tracking lacks spO2 measurement like the newer devices have.
customer_reviews.author: klrman

customer_reviews.title: Best GPS watch out there
customer_reviews.text: Best GPS watch out there. Do the reviews read them for yourself there is no comparison. Wonderful array of apps battery life is excellent build quality is solid backlighting is perfect colors are numerous. I would definitely buy this again and I don't think anything newer has come out that has any better features and I can not imagine what those would be anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Skeetorius

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Garmin watch! I upgraded my forerunner after my Apple Watch broke and this watch is way better than any smart watches out there! Beautiful look!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Barboza

customer_reviews.title: best watch, it is perfect for every kind of fitness activity
customer_reviews.text: this is a watch that I would recommend anyone to get who is looking to run, train or for fitness. I haven't used all the features but whatever I have, it is amazing. The interval training, the running bit, the cycling workout and the cardio. The apple watch in comparison to this doesn't do all these activities, so if you are looking at getting something which can have more apps and just a basic activity tracker. This one is a perfect activity tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Harsh

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed, last Garmin, 1/2 the price still did the simple things
customer_reviews.text: This is the most I have spent on a watch for sport. I have spent HOURS AND HOURS trying to do simple things. 1. EMAIL 2. TEXT My career down not allow for me to stare at my phone all day!! I am in the Operating Room. I am in an office setting where it would be rude to Stare at my phone. A quick. Look at my phone to know my daughter is or isn’t ok...for a $500 watch WTH.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing watch--Well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Amazing watch--Well worth the cost. I was worried that it would be too big for my wrist (I have skinny wrist)..but no issues. Great looking watch, comfortable and easy to use! I've been using it for over a month now and run 4-5 days a week, the accuracy is spot on-- Heart rate does not miss anything when running or during the day. Data transfer is seamless and the app on my phone is great. I only have to charge it about every 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: CVreviews

customer_reviews.title: Best sports watch ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Say what you want to say about the Garmin Fenix 5 but it's worth it's price. I had Garmin watches before and this model takes them all down. Easy to operate and the resolution is amazing! The 47 mm size version is just what I was looking for on a Garmin watch. If you are a outdoor person this is the watch for you, the only con I find is that if you like to take your music with you this is not the watch for you but if you are ok with the no music factor definitely get it!.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: Best watch I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Love garmin almost anything. This watch is fantastic. I am not one of those people that expect a watch to have a perfect heart rate monitor as well as a perfect altitude measurement. Works great for running, cycling, and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Tony G

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Have It
customer_reviews.text: In my search for a smart watch that had the functions I was looking for and was waterproof, I tried a few different ones. The Garmin Fenix 5X is a killer! Perfectly syncs to my phone, the app is easy to use, super stylish and well worth the money. With GPS turned off, who is using their GPS 24/7 anyway, the battery lasts about 2 weeks and recharges super fast!
customer_reviews.author: NICK

customer_reviews.title: works great in woods
customer_reviews.text: Bought for hunting in rural area. GPS worked great. Other features are a bonus and less used.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Finally fallen in love...
customer_reviews.text: I am retracting my previous bad review. Partly because it was written during the height of my frustration, but mainly to express all the positives of the wrist-worn miracle (and one issue, admittedly was self-induced). The Fenix 5X has all the features that I was looking for in a watch. It takes a while to learn to maneuver through the copious menus. Yes, it froze up on me once, but then again,I own zero devices (other than my toaster) that have never had that issue. I have fallen in love with this watch. You can buy it now!
customer_reviews.author: CE

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful watch
customer_reviews.text: My husband was eyeballing this watch for me for a while. I love the watch, it's amazing all the things it's capable of doing.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch with 2 week battery life
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. Not only does the battery last for up to 2 weeks it just simply feels more durable and has far better activity sensors than the Apple Watch 2 I switched from. All around great watch. Only comment is that the big area where it falls short is screen resolution but I’ll take the better battery life anyday.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller wrists but bands are way too short!
customer_reviews.text: Great "mini-5x". I like the size overall versus my older Fenix 3, but the bands are way too small for a man. I see they made larger bands but they are too expensive. Considering selling this to get the Fenix 5.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Best watch I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, there is not much I do not like about this watch. Literally only thing I dislike about this watch is the band on it, for my wrist there is two options... "omg my circulation is cut off" and "well... this is just going everywhere". But that isn't hard to fix by getting a different band. I am happy with this purchase 100%.
customer_reviews.author: John Pietsch

customer_reviews.title: Best fitness smartwatch on the planet.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is gorgeous and super useful. I have cycled through a Garmin Forerunner 410, a Garmin Vivoactive, a Apple Watch, and two Pebbles (original and Time Steel) before landing on this. It is awesome to be able to see my heartrate constantly, to not need my Garmin 520 when I am commuting by bike, and to be able to control music easily through physical buttons instead of swipes. And you can easily dress it up (or down) by changing bands. Love it love it.
customer_reviews.author: rshung

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: love the watch! It keeps track of everything and allows you to change the screen all the time. Just wish it was touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: whitney conder

customer_reviews.title: It’s awesome
customer_reviews.text: This watch Garmin 5x plus Sapphire is AWESOME!!!!! It is everything you want in a watch. I cannot write enough about this watch and what it does! There is not enough space to tell you everything this watch does! Get one! You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Belongs in the trash
customer_reviews.text: This this is absolute trash. The screen looks absolutely terrible, using the buttons to navigate the user interface is not intuitive. The two separate apps you need to download on your phone just to use the watch are constantly having errors (using iPhone X) . Please do not waste your money on this horrific “smart” watch.
customer_reviews.author: craig sabbagh

customer_reviews.title: Durable triathlon watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. So many great features. Although the battery life is comparable to other watches on the market, it doesn't have the same life as the vivoactive 3 which I upgraded from. I use it for run, bike, and swim daily. Feels solid, like drop out of a helicopter solid. Picks up my power meter on my bike automatically uploads to the most popular fitness tracking services (Garmin connect, training peaks, etc). Has all the smart notifications for your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Knowlton

customer_reviews.title: So many features to master
customer_reviews.text: It took a while...a lot of fiddling around and watching youtube videos. BUT, this watch is amazing! You can customize it for ANY activity you can think of. So many watch faces, apps, and widgets...
customer_reviews.author: Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Great for trail or jogging
customer_reviews.text: Small, little weight, fancy with removable color straps, excellent GPS guidance ( tracking third parties). Love it!
customer_reviews.author: julian jaramllo b

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. All the things I need that 935 didn't have (maps)! Definitely heavier,but I knew that going in. Haven't had long enough to gauge durability,but as all Garmin I have had before they are pretty durable. Will update further if/when issues arise.
customer_reviews.author: paul guthrie jr

customer_reviews.title: Best watch
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned a bunch of GPS smart watches from Garmin, and this is by far the best value for money watch I’ve had yet. What a steal of a deal! Now would I pay $600 for it? Idk. But the dale they had was too good to pass up, and it is super functional, pinpoint GPS, the barometer is useful for my migraine prediction, and it’s very customizable in numerous ways
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent watch, but my NOH unit had sensors problems
customer_reviews.text: Really love this watch, ticks all the boxes and looks awesome. Unfortunately, none of the sensors on the fenix 5 NOH unit i received worked... very disappointed. So returned it and re-orded another one... hope they get right this time.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Best GPS sport watch
customer_reviews.text: popularity of this watch well-known for everyone and it goes without saying that how much mountaineers rely on this watch. I am so glad I finally bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Hooman

customer_reviews.title: Superb GPS watch - Probably the best !
customer_reviews.text: The definitive GPS watch for sports and fitness tracking and data. Waited till 2018 to purchase but was worth it . Love everything about it, from customized watch faces, wrist based heart rate monitoring to swappable wrist band straps.It has a ton of serious features for the athlete/triathlete which is great in analyzing and monitoring your performance progress. You can also use it as a navigator by loading maps which may need some tinkering, if its outside the USA. The battery lasts for more than 10 days with my GPS usage and general use, so you are never stressed to charge it. If you can splurge the $, go for it you won't regret it .
customer_reviews.author: Mohan Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough great things about this watch. As long as you don't care about fancy graphics and responding to texts and messages via your watch, this is an amazing smart watch. IMO - And no other smart watch can track activities better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing watch
customer_reviews.text: I just got the Garmin 5s Sapphire. This product looks great and the fit is perfect for me. So much to learn still. However, garmin sends you all type of videos to learn everything about the watch.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: I use it daily, sometimes the band will irritate my wrist but goes away once I take it off for a while. Stays charges for a long time. seems pretty accurate from what I can tell. Pairs nicely with my wahoo chest strap.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: It has all the features that it promised and they seem to work well. I have had it about a month and have worn it 24x7 days a week. Battery life is good, only charged it a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M

customer_reviews.title: Resolution is not good
customer_reviews.text: watch resolution is not as good as the picture shows.. it looks like a screen from an old colored phone..
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Gandeza

customer_reviews.title: Feminine yet Functional
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic watch with a feminine touch. It’s about time companies like Garmin are finally marketing a more feminine-looking, stylish watch with a smaller profile and band circumstance. Perfect for triathlon training.
customer_reviews.author: L. Altman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic watch.
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic watch. Great for the outdoorsy type like myself and for those that are just trying to get a better handle on your healthy lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Value meets function
customer_reviews.text: Great product that was in much better condition than described. Works great and looks great. I would buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Gartner

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Fenix 5s!!! I upgraded from Garmin 220. I run marathon, so knowing the distance is very important, it's accurate, light weight and also very pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Konnie

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. Looks like brand new. Does not receive text messages; that's maybe the only down fall. But it's a great watch.
customer_reviews.author: Happy buyer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this watch!! Still getting used to all the features and remembering how to access them. GPS widget was great when I was out land navigating and given a general direction of “West” to follow. It fits beautifully!! Finally a comprehensive watch made for smaller wrists!!
customer_reviews.author: LASH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Its a beauty. I use it everyday and while running and swimming. Couldnt be happier. Well maybe if it was a little bit cheaper, but I'm over that haha. For me the size of this watch is great, I'm 5'9 feet. The wristband seems to wear up around the edges wile swimming, maybe its because of strong chemicals in my pool. So it might be a good idea to use the yellow wristband while swimming or something. Have a great day
customer_reviews.author: Magnús

product_meta.title: Garmin Fenix 5X Sapphire - Slate Gray with Black Band
product_meta.description: Combining world-class performance with the best features of our fitness and outdoor watches, Fenix 5X is the premiere multisport training companion. It’s the first Fenix series watch to offer full-color TOPO U.S. mapping for at-a-glance navigation and location reference -so you can beat yesterday, and be sure of getting back. You get advanced features such as Elevate wrist heart rate technology, built-in activity profiles, performance metrics and training status readings that show the fitness-enhancing effects of your workout. Smart notifications help you stay in touch on the go. Plus, Quick Fit bands let you tailor the look to any lifestyle or activity -no tools required. Go from workplace to workout without breaking stride. Smartphone compatibility - iPhone, Android. Memory 16 GB.
feature_bullets: Ultimate multisport GPS watch with full color Topo U.S. mapping, routable cycling maps and other outdoor navigation features
Fit for adventure with rugged design that features stainless steel bezel, buttons and rear case: Physical size 5.1 x 5.1 x 1.8 centimeter; Weight silicone band: 98 grams ; Metal band: 196 grams
Built in navigation sensors include GPS and Glonass capability to track in more challenging environments than GPS alone as well as 3 axis compass, gyroscope and barometric altimeter
Preloaded run profiles: Running, treadmill running, trail running. Put key stats at your fingertips with the performance widget that shows your training status, training load and more
Connected features include smart notifications, automatic uploads to Garmin connect online fitness community and personalization through free watch faces and apps from our connect IQ store

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,167 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
